summary: Adds fully functional and ready-to-use magical wands to Skyrim. They are not remodeled staves and provide their own fun and unique gameplay experience. It's like Harry Potter, but in Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[center][IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/2cz7wo5.png[/IMG][/center]

[center][font="Arial Black"][size=5][u]NEWS[/u][/size][/font][/center]
[center][font="Arial Black"][size=4]Spells can cost stamina (you can change this in the MCM Menu)
MCM Menu... Finally!
3 new spells: Burn, Hypothermia, and Electrocute
Enhanced Ward: now drains magicka, and looks better!
New Nordic Wand designed by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3297180/?]Ghosu[/url]!
[/size][/font][/center]


[center][font="Arial Black"][size=4]WOS adds fully functional and ready-to-use wands with eleven spells: Firebolt, Fireball, Burn, Ice Spike, Ice Storm, Hypothermia, Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, Electrocute, Gust, and Disarm, plus a ward spell when the player "blocks". Whenever you "swing" your wand, a spell will be shot out of the end. Each spell does damage based on the wand's level and costs 75% leveled magicka.[/size][/font][/center]

[center][font="Arial Black"][size=5]This is not just another "staff-that-looks-like-a-wand mod". So before you leave this page and continue to wait for an immersive wand mod, I just want to tell you that[/size][size=5][color=red]
THESE ARE NOT STAVES--IT'S A WHOLE NEW WEAPON-TYPE[/color][/size][/font][/center]

[center][font="Arial Black"][size=4]Version 1.41 Review[/size][size=2] by [url=http://www.youtube.com/user/nozi87?feature=watch]Nozi87[/url][/size][/font][/center]
[center][youtube]JoYVBPw23EA[/youtube][/center]

[center][font="Arial Black"][size=4]Version 1.3 Review[/size][size=2] by [url=http://www.youtube.com/user/nozi87?feature=watch]Nozi87[/url][/size][/font][/center]
[center][youtube]rmcAOthc6ls[/youtube][/center]

[img]http://i59.tinypic.com/2rp5ybr.png[/img]

[img]http://s30.postimg.org/soq6e5syp/Spells_Update_zpse0ce94d5.png[/img]

[img]http://i323.photobucket.com/albums/nn466/Constance_M/Requires_zpsae200784.png[/img]
1. SKSE ([url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/72850/discussions/0/846955554753327781/]Installation Guide[/url])
2. [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?]SkyUI[/url]

[img]http://i323.photobucket.com/albums/nn466/Constance_M/Todolist_zpsf910061c.png[/img]
1. Support more spells
[s]2. When blocking, use ward spell[/s]
3. During power attacks, increase spell damage
4. Add more wands with different abilities

[img]http://i323.photobucket.com/albums/nn466/Constance_M/FAQ_zps5665a984.png[/img]
Q: I know its not a remodeled staff, but what does it do? I'm so confused.
A: In short, when you swing the wand, it will cast a spell forward. I know its confusing, the mechanics are unlike anything else (and are really fun). Once you download it, it will make complete sense. Just think about Harry Potter: he swings his wand, and a spell is shot out of his wand. Its like that, but in Skyrim.

Q: Why do I need SKSE? It seems like a waste of space.
A: SKSE is surely not a waste of space. It is what allows some of the greatest mods to exist. WOS uses SKSE to actually cast the spells through the event OnActorAction, where there is no workaround. So please reconsider downloading SKSE.

Q: What makes this different from the other wand mods?
A: WOS is not like the other "wand" mods since they are what I like to call "staff-that-looks-like-a-wand mod". And frankly, in my opinion, it's not very pleasing to the eye or immersive. WOS wands will feel like they came with Vanilla Skyrim. They use the same animations as daggers, allowing the player to truly feel like they are swinging and casting spells from their magical wooden stick. It creates a new style of gameplay. No other weapon is like this, not even vanilla staves.

[img]http://i323.photobucket.com/albums/nn466/Constance_M/Thanks_zps39c1b68a.png[/img]
-Constance for the wand texture and page design
-[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3297180/?]Ghosu[/url] for the Nordic wand design, model, and texture! Check out Ghosu's work!
-Raze01 for the beautiful, high quality photos
-[url=http://www.youtube.com/user/nozi87?feature=watch]Nozi87[/url] for the amazing mod reviews. Subscribe to his [url=http://www.youtube.com/user/nozi87?feature=watch]channel[/url]!

This is my first mod so I would love feedback!!!
author: Sokco816
